examples: The three German brands, BMW, Mercedes and Audi have historically controlled sixty percent of that market.
Historically, the world’s favorite depressant is alcohol.
Historically, concerns about video games were bipartisan.
Senators jump at that opportunity historically.
Historically, Twinkies only lasted 25 days.
words.defineEn: in a way related to the past
words.defineVi: trong một cách liên quan đến quá khứ

examples: A secure background will help a child to grow emotionally.
I’m not emotionally ready for chores just yet, so please give me some slack.
How do you break someone psychologically, mentally, or emotionally?
She was jealous, humiliated, and emotionally at the end of her tether.
For many people, the term concentration camp is too emotionally charged.
words.defineEn: in a way that is related to feelings and emotions
words.defineVi: theo cách có liên quan đến cảm giác và cảm xúc

examples: Jane always goes to town on her work, consistently producing high-quality results.
The musician stayed on a roll by consistently releasing popular songs and albums, maintaining a dedicated fanbase and expanding their reach to new audiences.
The athlete who trains regularly and consistently knows that constant dropping wears away a stone and is more likely to perform well in competition.
Mary always wakes up at 5:00 am to study, and she consistently gets good grades - it's true that the early bird catches the worm.
The government has consistently underestimated the death toll here.
words.defineEn: in a way that is always the same
words.defineVi: theo cách luôn luôn giống nhau

examples: Nonetheless, scientific consensus is a powerful tool.
Nonetheless, these bizarre plants left behind a big legacy.
But nonetheless, we have an obligation to the families.
Nonetheless, he had used immigration to some effect in the campaign.
Nonetheless, Hitler found success with them.
words.defineEn: despite what was just mentioned
words.defineVi: mặc dù những gì vừa được đề cập

examples: The colorful bird flew high in the sky.
The prices at the luxury boutique were quite high.
Unfortunately, the price of short ribs can be quite high.
He had high expectations for the team's performance in the tournament.
They set high standards of customer service.
words.defineEn: to, at, or far above the ground
words.defineVi: đến, tại, hoặc xa trên mặt đất

examples: She participates actively in class discussions and shares her opinions.
Sarah knew that in order to accomplish their project successfully, she needed to play ball with her team members and actively listen to their ideas and suggestions.
He had got it going on during his time in college, excelling academically and being actively involved in campus activities.
For decades, the U.S. government actively increased the number of hospital beds.
Today, about 19,000 men and women actively serve in the Border Patrol.
words.defineEn: with a persistent and determined effort
words.defineVi: với sự nỗ lực bền bỉ và quyết tâm

examples: Our favorite restaurant has gone to the dogs lately.
There's a lot of police activity around here lately.
She's had a lot of time on her hands lately.
Lately, I've been dealing with constipation.
Alex has been really gloomy lately.
words.defineEn: not a long time ago
words.defineVi: cách đây không lâu

examples: He has publicly acknowledged the economy is not his strong point.
The coach dug his own grave when he publicly insulted the team's owner.
Sally decided to quit her job and publicly criticize her former employer, effectively burning her bridges with the company.

The stiff upper lip that had gotten the British thorough the London Blitz during World War II just wasn't the right attitude for a population that was now much more willing to show their emotions publicly.
Publicly, U.S. officials have confirmed few details of Ethiopian and their allies' actions.
words.defineEn: in a way that is observable by other people, or for everyone to hear
words.defineVi: theo cách mà người khác có thể quan sát được hoặc cho mọi người nghe

examples: Traditionally, manufacturers in France, Germany, Israel, the United Kingdom and the United States have supplied the majority of the world's crowd-control weapons.
And inaction, traditionally, has a consequence.
Traditionally, only pine logs are used.
Traditionally, spacesuits are very expensive.
Well, what does negative traditionally mean?
words.defineEn: according to methods, beliefs, or customs that have remained unchanged for a long period of time
words.defineVi: theo các phương pháp, tín ngưỡng hoặc phong tục không thay đổi trong một thời gian dài

examples: Since the forties he has led his own big bands.
The company has held the advertising contract since 2005.
Things have changed dramatically since then.
Almost fifty years have passed since that day.
That monument has been there since the year one.
words.defineEn: between a particular time in the past and now
words.defineVi: giữa một thời điểm cụ thể trong quá khứ và bây giờ

examples: The car accident was scary, but thankfully no one was seriously injured - nothing so bad but might have been worse.
Thankfully, philosophers love a good definition.
Thankfully, scientists have proposed a solution.
Thankfully, the captioner did come.
This one is not, thankfully.
words.defineEn: used to express appreciation for something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện sự đánh giá cao cho một cái gì đó

examples: Sadly, new customers are being enticed by tempting promotions only to find the dice are loaded against them.
"The good die young," said the pastor sadly at Robert's funeral, for even at the age of 80, his kindness, faith and generosity made his passing feel far too soon.
I hired Jess only because she thinks quick on her feet, an attribute that you sadly do not possess.
She should have known better than to trust him again after he had already betrayed her once, yet sadly it is a silly fish that is caught twice with the same bait.
because, sadly, the groom died.
words.defineEn: used to express that something is sad, regrettable, or unfortunate
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện rằng một cái gì đó là buồn, đáng tiếc, hoặc không may

examples: They keep a small eraser in their pencil case for quick corrections.
Just a quick note to say thank you for a wonderful evening.
He was quick to point a finger at his coworkers.
The tabloids were quick to label the famous actor as a backdoor man after rumors circulated about his affairs with multiple co-stars.
I'll be back quicker than you can say Jack Robinson.
words.defineEn: in a manner that is fast and takes little time
words.defineVi: một cách nhanh chóng và mất ít thời gian

examples: We're just little frogs in a big pond, doing all the printing and copying without any recognition whatsoever.
I've never had a taste for fighting of any kind, so I know I would not be suited to the army whatsoever.
Even the teachers gave him no support whatsoever.
It makes no sense whatsoever.
That makes no sense whatsoever.
words.defineEn: (used for emphasis) not at all
words.defineVi: (dùng để nhấn mạnh) hoàn toàn không

examples: This company is partially deaf-owned.
Dogs are partially colorblind.
These oil prices are at least partially the result of the U.S. administration's own actions.
So far, nearly 63 percent of U.S. adults are at least partially immunized.
My medication actually partially stops the pain synapses in my brain from firing.
words.defineEn: to a limited degree or extent
words.defineVi: ở một mức độ hạn chế hoặc mức độ

examples: College tuitions cost an arm and leg nowadays.
Five pounds doesn't buy much nowadays.
In the past, it was common to send handwritten letters but nowadays email is the preferred method of communication, other times, other manners.
Nowadays, prisoners use postage stamps and even small packages of mackerel as currency.
Nowadays, other options are available.
words.defineEn: at the present time, as opposed to the past
words.defineVi: ở thời điểm hiện tại, trái ngược với quá khứ

examples: Interestingly, high-end retailers sometimes do the opposite.
Interestingly, our loans are 9 month duration.
Interestingly, brown dwarfs are a better bet as an energy source.
Interestingly King James hated smoking.
Interestingly, army ants don't fight army ants.
words.defineEn: in a way that arouses one's curiosity or attention
words.defineVi: theo cách khơi dậy sự tò mò hoặc sự chú ý của một người

examples: Nevertheless, all the efforts that we made, we were not successful in getting hold of him.
I advised him for one hour straight, yet he played the man and not the ball nevertheless.
Nevertheless, the phenomenon continued.
Nevertheless, at the time, the case did serious damage to the Audi brand with image and safety conscious baby-boomers.
Nevertheless, he copes.
words.defineEn: regardless of the statement that was just referred to or mentioned
words.defineVi: bất kể tuyên bố vừa được đề cập hoặc đề cập

examples: Therefore, while they may represent a port in a storm, they are fundamentally unattractive business models.
The surge in popularity of streaming gaming has fundamentally changed Microsoft's relationships with one of its longtime rivals.
Ostrom’s ideas fundamentally challenged our understanding of dinosaurs.
The '94 elections had fundamentally changed the nature of the Republican Party.
For one thing, they fundamentally changed the landscape of the Pacific Northwest.
words.defineEn: in every respect that is important
words.defineVi: trong mọi khía cạnh đó là quan trọng

examples: Knowledge of cooking comes easy to him.
The whole procedure is as easy as ABC.
A ramp allows easy access for wheelchairs.
Using the camera was as easy as pie.
It's an easy exam.
words.defineEn: with no effort or difficulty
words.defineVi: không có nỗ lực hoặc khó khăn

examples: The entrepreneur was trying to launch two different businesses simultaneously, but learned that if you run after two hares, you will catch neither, and decided to prioritize one business and put the other on hold.
This industrious structure simultaneously acts as a storehouse, a manufacturing hub, and a processing plant.
In 1923, two guys simultaneously defined acids and bases in the exact same way.
A female kangaroo can often simultaneously support one inside her uterus and another in her pouch.
Throughout time, cats were simultaneously solitary predators of smaller animals and prey for larger carnivores.
words.defineEn: at exactly the same time
words.defineVi: chính xác cùng một lúc

examples: I believe that chiles are an essential ingredient in many traditional cuisines worldwide.
Spanish art, such as the works of Pablo Picasso and Salvador Dalí, is renowned worldwide.
Our bestselling album did about a million worldwide.
The book became a worldwide best-seller, largely by the word of mouth.
Worldwide, Solenopsis ranges as far south as the southern tips of South America, Africa, and Australia.
words.defineEn: all over the world
words.defineVi: trên toàn thế giới

examples: We often take weekend trips to nearby cities for sightseeing and relaxation.
The injured animal cried in distress, attracting the attention of nearby hikers.
He parked his car on the street and walked to the nearby café.
Mark's excessive motion sickness during the roller coaster ride forced him to take a break and drive the porcelain bus in the nearby restroom.
Even though John wasn't her ideal match, Mary decided to marry him because he was a good man who lived nearby, following the old saying better wed over the mixen than over the moor.
words.defineEn: not in the distance
words.defineVi: không ở xa

examples: The whole is sometime less than the sum of its parts.
Sometime during the Ordovician and into the Silurian, life made the jump to land.
Ichthyosaurs disappeared sometime during the Cretaceous.
Come on back sometime.
Sometime people misinterpret my flirtiness.
words.defineEn: at a time that is unknown or unspecified
words.defineVi: tại một thời điểm không xác định hoặc không xác định

words.defineEn: in the end or after a lot of waiting
words.defineVi: cuối cùng hoặc sau rất nhiều chờ đợi
